subject: Art & Design
title: Leading and Tracking: Breathing Room for Text
description: A micro-lesson that makes Leading and Tracking: Breathing Room for Text usable.

hook.text: Cramped lines of text feel suffocating. Too much space feels disconnected. Leading controls this.

buildup.text: Leading (line-height) is the vertical space between baselines. Named after lead strips in printing presses.

discovery.text: Tracking (letter-spacing) adjusts space uniformly across all letters â€” unlike kerning's per-pair approach.

twist.text: Uppercase text needs extra tracking. Without it, capital letters look jammed together.

climax.text: The sweet spot for body text leading is 1.4-1.6Ã— the font size. Tighter for headings, looser for body.

punchline.text: Space isn't empty. It's the rhythm between the notes.
